passage.text: Estimates of complications of medical care in the adult US population
Morbidity is more elevated due to complications of medical care, and there is some evidence that socio-demographic factors play a role in modifying injury risk.
The aspiration of gastric contents can lead to bronchoconstriction and is the most commonly observed pathogenic factor for pneumonia, particularly in ventilated patients.

Despite the fact that early hyperglycaemia is not the only risk factor for transplant rejection, it is highly likely that patients with diabetes will also experience similar symptoms. This study and previous studies suggest that tightly controlling sugar intake after transplantation can help reduce allograft injury and rejection episodes in non-diabetic patients (see our earlier research).
